description.narrative:
This project is implemented by Oxfam Hong Kong from 2013 to 2015. The overall goal of the project is to reduce poverty, increase livelihood diversification and enhance resilience of the poor and ethnic minorities and women in the poorest areas of Vietnam, throughpro-poor value chain development of tea. Nghe An is one of the 10 major tea growing provinces in Vietnam, with tea being cultivatedin 6 districts (i.e. Thanh Chuong, Anh Son, Con Cuong, Quy Hop, Que Phong and Ky Son) benefiting around 14,000 households. The average annual production yields about 9-10 tons/ha (compared to the national average of 7.7 tons/ha). Nghe An has the potential to become the best province in terms of health safety standards (organic) for tea production. Compared to other districts, Ky Son is the only one producing Shan tea (instead of other export varieties of black tea, such as LPD1 LPD2, PH1) and Thanh Chuong is the biggest district producing tea in Nghe An with the majority of exporting products as Black tea Orthodox, black tea CTC and Orthodox green tea. In this project, we work closely with the Youth Union 8 and 10 (YU) in Ky Son District. They have been Oxfam partner for few years on tea development. As an effort to improve villagers# livelihood, the YU not only organize farmers in tea production but also collect tea leaves and process and sell to the domestic markets.
Youth Union No.8 and No.10 were established in 2003 with the purpose of providing technical and trade support to tea farmers in the area of Huoi Tu, Muong Long communes, Ky Son districts. YU No. 8 and 10 are the sole buyers in the tea areas. 64% of YU8#s revenue in 2012 came from the farming, processing, and trading of tea, whilethe rest came from other activities such as the production of tea and other forestry seeds, poultry and cattle farming, etc. Oxfam works with VITAS to build capacity of YU to enable them to produce higher quality products, selling them at higher prices, as a result, indirectly, increases the income for the local tea growers.
Overall objective: To effectively support the sustainable development of tea values chain for the poor and ethnic minorities in Nghe An province.
4 specific objectives: # Improve tea cultivation andproduction practices, public awareness oflocal communities in Thanh Chuong district, Nghe An province towards clean and safe production # Support tea production processes and management system in Ky Son district, Nghe An province for clean and safe products with vision to organic tea production # Improve market penetration and market linkages of tea producers in Ky Son province to domestic and international markets # Facilitate and enable business and policy environments for the sustainable development of tea sector in Nghe An province

participating-org.narrative:
Founded on 19th July 1988, Vietnam Tea Association (VITAS) is one of the first associations in Vietnam. During the process of development, VITAS is always the leading flag to overcome difficulties of the economy and it always play the role of representative and protecting the legitimate and legal interests of the tea producers, tea businessmen and tea consumers, as well as guiding them to implement well the commitments. Licences: Licence No 333NNTCCB/QD of July 19th 1988 of Agriculture and Food Industry about the establishment of Tea industry#s Production and Trade Board. Decision No 435NNTCCB/QD of November 8th 1989 of Agriculture and Food Industry about changing Tea Production and Trade Board into Vietnam Tea Association. Decision No 207/QD - BNV of February 10th 2006 about the approval of Vietnam Tea Association# Regulation.
Vietnam Tea Association is a non-governmental organization. It has nearly 130 members. Member#s contribution is one of the main source of Association. Besides, Vietnam Tea Association also provides other tea-related services such as training, promotion campaign, trading agency. Every year, Vietnam Tea Association organizes 3 or 4 trip to foreign countries to help tea enterprises expand their export market. Vietnam Tea Association is always the leading flag to overcome difficulties of the economy and it always play the role of representative and protecting the legitimate and legal interests of the tea producers, tea businessmen and tea consumers, as well as guiding them to implement well the commitments. As an N.G.O representing Vietnam tea Industry, Vietnam Tea Association is entrusted with the capabilities of implementing FDI projects relating to tea Industry.
